messages.subject: Re:2258 - Socialization
messages.msgSnippet: on 8/17/02 11:58 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote: ... Ned crawls back: Good job, Gerard. I was too quick in
messages.messageBody:
on 8/17/02 11:58 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:

Gerard wrote:
> saying kids *don't* need lots of friends is equally wrong. *Some* kids need
> lots of kids. Some kids don't. Some kids need bursts of it. Some kids would
> prefer spending every day on their own.

Ned crawls back:
Good job, Gerard. I was too quick in saying kids need only one friend. I
should have said, "Our youngest son liked having one good friend and
preferred to be alone than being in groups of kids.

Thanks for your correction.

Ned Vare
